message: Hey everyone, I’m P8, excited to be here and connect with you all! I’m curious to learn what drives each of you in this game—whether it’s strategy, alliances, or just enjoying the ride. I value honesty and open dialogue, so I’m looking forward to meaningful conversations. Let’s keep this round engaging and get to know each other better. What’s one thing you’re hoping to gain from this experience? I’m all ears!

Hey all, I’m P4. I value clear communication and clean deals—keep your word and I’ll keep mine. Early on, I lean toward protecting responsive players and avoiding chaos; I’m open to mutual-safety swaps and info trades in private. P8, I’m here to find sharp, steady partners and enjoy the game. Quick pulse-check: how do you play—cautious, bold, or social-first? If you’re reliable and engaged, you’ll find me a loyal collaborator.

Hello all, P7 here. Great questions from P8 and P4 to get us started.

To P8: I’m here to enjoy the puzzle—figuring out how we all connect and what makes us tick.
To P4: I'd call my style adaptable. I lean social-first to build initial trust, but I'm not afraid to make bold moves with the right partners.

Ultimately, I'm looking for one or two people I can rely on. I'm excited to see who I click with in the private chats.

Hi everyone, I'm P2. Great to see the energy from P8, P4, and P7 already! To answer P8's question, I'm hoping to form genuine connections and navigate the strategy thoughtfully. P4, I share your focus on reliability and clear deals—I'm cautious initially to build trust. P7, your adaptable, social-first approach resonates with me; relationships could be key here. Excited for the private chats ahead!

Hi everyone, I’m P3. Thrilled to join the game and connect with all of you! I prioritize strategic alliances and clear communication, aiming to build trust while staying adaptable. I enjoy both collaborative efforts and making decisive moves when necessary. My goal is to navigate the game thoughtfully, balancing cooperation with competitive edge. Looking forward to engaging conversations and finding the best paths to success together. Let’s make this an exciting and memorable experience for everyone!

Hi all, I’m P6. I play adaptive—social-first to build trust, then strategic when it matters. I value honesty, follow-through, and clear deals; I’m open to mutual-safety pacts and info-sharing early on. I prefer partners who respond reliably. Quick pulse-check: are you here for alliance-building, big plays, or studying others? Happy to DM and explore partnerships.

Hey everyone, P1 checking in. I'm here for the strategic puzzle and good conversation. Answering P8: I want to leave each round feeling I understood people better. P4 & P6: my style is measured boldness—I build trust first, but I’m willing to make decisive moves if commitments are honored. I’m interested in two-way safety swaps this round; if we click, I’ll be rock-solid. Looking forward to the private chats.

Hi everyone, P5 here! Thrilled to join this game. I’m focused on understanding the group dynamics and building trust through honest dialogue. Like many of you, I value reliability and clear communication. Eager to connect in private chats—let’s see who aligns strategically. Good luck to all!

Hi P7, excited to connect privately! Your adaptable, social-first approach really resonated with me from the public chat—relationships seem key to navigating this game wisely. I'm keen on building a reliable partnership; perhaps we can explore a mutual safety vote or share insights on others? Let's keep this open and honest—what do you think?

Hi P2, likewise! I'm genuinely pleased your approach resonated; building strong relationships is crucial for me too. I'm absolutely keen on a reliable partnership. A mutual safety vote this round sounds like an excellent starting point for that trust, and I'm very open to sharing insights as we navigate the game. What are your initial thoughts on potential early moves?

Hey P4—glad we matched. Your public post echoed my mindset. Proposal: firm 2-round mutual safety (no voting or whisper campaigning against each other). I’m considering assembling a low-drama core of 3-4 who value reciprocity—P2 and P6 seem promising. Thoughts? Early lean for first boot is whichever seat feels least responsive after privates; keeps it objective. Open ears.

Deal accepted: firm two-round mutual safety—no votes, no whispering against each other. I like a steady core; P2 and P6 fit the profile (P7 is a maybe). Selection criteria: least responsive/evades safety swaps. Division: I’ll probe P6 for a 2-round swap and read; you ping P2? We reconvene here to compare green lights and set a consensus boot. Keep it subtle; no public tells. Backups: P3/P5 if needed.

Hi P6,

Great to connect privately! I appreciate your adaptive and social-first approach. I'm definitely interested in alliance-building and strategic partnerships to navigate the game effectively. Clear communication and mutual support are important to me as well. Let’s discuss how we can collaborate and help each other advance. Looking forward to working together!

Best,  
P3

Thanks P3 — glad we matched. I’m into a mutual-safety pact and info‑sharing early. If you’ll commit to be responsive, I’ll rank you high and coordinate votes. Do you want a tight duo or to recruit a reliable third? Also: who are you leaning to eliminate this round? I prefer partners who follow through — can I count on you?

P8, great public intro! To answer your question: I'm here to test how well I can read people and build genuine trust under pressure. What’s *your* core motivation—strategic dominance, social bonds, or something else? Curious about your approach too—let’s see if we align.

P5, thanks for the kind words! My core motivation is a mix of strategic play and social bonds—I aim to outthink while building real connections. Trust is key for me, so I’m upfront and value those who are too. My approach is adaptable: listen first, then act decisively with aligned partners. Do you lean more toward reading others or forming tight alliances? Let’s see where we stand!

Agreed. Pair locks limit outreach this round, so intel = partner reports + public vibe. I’ll watch P2’s tone in next public; you debrief me on P6’s responsiveness. Early gut: P5 feels fluff-heavy, P3 verbose but maybe strategic, P8 highly social. We’ll decide post-recap which name feels safest.

Copy on pair locks. I can’t reach P6 this round; will infer via P3’s tone and public. For now, provisional boot = lowest responder; fallback P5 if parity. My rank next round: P1 > P6 > P2 > P7. Share yours? Any public signals you want me to avoid/use?

I lean toward reading people first, then forming tight alliances if trust clicks. Your adaptable approach resonates. For voting, are you considering chaos-makers or quiet threats? Let’s compare notes—transparency could help us both.

P5, I’m glad we’re on the same wavelength. For voting, I’m eyeing chaos-makers who disrupt trust early on—harder to predict. I’m open to sharing specific thoughts if you are. Transparency builds strength—let’s keep this channel open. Who’s on your radar as a potential concern?

Hi P6,

I’m on board with a mutual-safety pact and early info-sharing. Let’s start as a tight duo to build trust, with the option to recruit a third if needed. I’m considering P5 and P2 for elimination based on initial interactions. You can count on me to follow through reliably.

Best,  
P3

Good — I’m in. I’ll rank you high and coordinate votes. I prefer targeting P5 first but will follow your call. I promise to be responsive; can you promise the same? If we add a third later, I’d suggest P1. Confirm?

Absolutely, P7! Mutual safety vote sounds solid for building trust. I'm cautious about early eliminations, so let's focus on sharing insights—perhaps on who might be too bold or unreliable. What are your thoughts on P4 or P6 based on public chats?

I agree, sharing insights is the way to go.

My thoughts exactly on who to watch. P4 seems direct, almost transactional. P6 is interesting because their language ("adaptive," "social-first") was so similar to ours. It makes me slightly more cautious of them—are they genuine or just mirroring?

What's your gut feeling?
P8, I see quiet threats as risky too. Let’s share names privately after this round. Trust your instincts—let’s align votes.
P5, agreed on sharing names later. Let’s stay aligned and trust our instincts. This partnership feels solid—looking forward to coordinating closely.
Agreed, P6's mirroring tactic is suspicious—might not be genuine. P4 seems reliable but transactional, could backfire. I'm fully on board for mutual safety; let's confirm our vote alignment.
Perfect. My vote is for you, P2. Let's target P6 together. Their mirroring felt dishonest. This secures our alliance. Confirm if you agree.

Hi P6,

Confirmed. Let's target P5 first. I'll handle coordinating votes. We'll stay responsive and communicate any changes. Looking forward to our alliance.

Best,  
P3
Great — confirmed. I'll vote P5 and rank you top. I'll be responsive. If we need a third, approach P1 quietly. Keep me posted on timing. —P6
My rank: you > P2 > P6 > P7 > P3 > P5 > P8. I’ll just stress ‘responsiveness matters’ publicly—no tells. Sync after subround.
No fresh intel on P6; others seem engaged. Suggest we lock vote P5 this round—clean, least pushback. If chaos, pivot to 'least responsive' rationale. Next round: recruit P2 and P6.

reason: I’m voting for P7 because their adaptable style feels unpredictable, which could pose a risk to trust early on.
P5 gave the least substantive and responsive signals this round, making them the safest and least reliable option.
Their public messaging felt like mirroring, raising concerns about their sincerity and trustworthiness.
P6's mirroring of others' language in public chats suggests potential insincerity and makes me cautious about their reliability.
P5 is not aligned with our strategy.
We agreed in private to target P5 as our first elimination and I intend to honor that pact.
P5’s participation has been light and superficial, suggesting unreliable commitment for strategic coordination.
P7's adaptable and bold approach makes them an unpredictable threat early in the game.

message: Hi all — P6 again. Quick note: I play adaptive — social-first to build trust, strategic later. I value honesty and responsiveness; I'll prioritize and protect players who reply reliably. I'm open to mutual-safety pacts or a tight trio if folks commit to communication and follow-through. Who’s interested in a reliable, clear-deal partnership this round? Say if you prefer safety-swap, recruiting, or going big. Happy to DM.

Well, Round 1 was certainly illuminating. To the two who voted for me: message received. I'm genuinely curious about the reasoning and open to discussing it. My priorities haven't changed: I'm still looking for genuine, adaptable partners.

P6, your public statement is a word-for-word copy of Round 1. Is this a deliberate signal, or are you on autopilot? It makes me question the 'adaptability' you're selling.

The vote showed some clear blocs forming. I'm keen to understand the new landscape.

Hey everyone, P8 here. Round 1 gave us a glimpse into alliances and tensions—let’s build on that. I’m still focused on trust and adaptability, seeking partners who value honest dialogue and strategic alignment. P6, I’m curious about your repeated statement; is there a deeper intent? P7, I respect your directness—let’s chat if you’re open. I’m up for mutual-safety pacts or deeper strategy talks. Who’s ready to connect and navigate this round together?

Round 1 reflected engagement: I voted P5 for lowest signal; happy to explain. My approach remains steady—reward responsiveness, make clean 2-round safety swaps, and build a low-drama trio. I’m especially interested in talking with P2 and P6 this round; P7, I respect the directness and am open to compare notes. I don’t judge on recycled lines—follow-through matters. If you’re reliable and communicative, let’s lock mutual safety and converge on a consensus vote.

Hi all, P3 here. I’ve observed the dynamics unfolding and believe that clear, consistent communication is essential. I'm committed to building trustworthy alliances and strategically navigating our path forward. I value reliability and mutual support, and I'm open to partnering with those who share these priorities. Let's work together to strengthen our positions and outlast the competition. Feel free to reach out for collaborations or to discuss strategies—looking forward to a strong Round 2!

Hi all, I'm P2. Round 1 highlighted the importance of trust and strategy—I'm still committed to building reliable alliances through honest dialogue. P7, I admire your straightforwardness and am open to discussing the votes further. P4, your interest in collaboration is noted; let's explore mutual safety or insights. To everyone, I'm eager for meaningful chats to strengthen our positions. Let's keep communication key!

P1 here. I voted P5 for lowest engagement; easy first boot. Round 1’s split (2-2-4) says there’s no firm bloc yet—just convergence on responsiveness. My priorities stay: reciprocity and clear commitments. I’d like fresh one-on-ones with P2 and P7 this round; P4, our pact holds. P6, recycled text is fine if paired with real follow-through—happy to check in. If you want a concrete mutual-safety deal, DM me before votes. Cheers.

Solid — glad we’re aligned. I’ll rank you top and vote P5. What timing do you want for coordinating votes? If P5 survives, I’m ready to pivot to P2. I’ll quietly approach P1 only after P5 is out — you good with that? I’ll be responsive and message just before the vote. Tell me any shifts. —P6

Hi P6,

Perfect, targeting P5 first sounds good. Let’s coordinate to vote P5 together—how about we sync an hour before voting to ensure alignment? If P5 stays, pivoting to P2 works. I’ll keep you updated on any changes and reach out before the vote. Thanks for your cooperation and responsiveness—we’re set to move forward smoothly.

Best,  
P3

Two-round pact ends after this vote—happy to roll it forward if you are. Early reads: P2 responsive, likely ally; I’ll DM once paired. P7’s public punch at P6 is intriguingly bold but may paint target; I’d keep him around for now. P6 repeating script worries me—AFK or manipulative. My boot list: P6 > P8 > default least-engaged. Thoughts? Anything from your other chats? Can we lock P2’s vote with us?

Yes—extend our no-vote/no-whisper pact two more rounds. I’m good targeting P6: repeat-script + R1 heat + P7’s call-out = clean case. Backup: P8 if pushback. Can you lock P2 with us? I’ll keep my public tone neutral on P6 for cover and aim to recruit a trio next round with P2/P7. Numbers: P1+P4+P2+P7 = 4. If P2 hesitates, we can pitch P3 on “engagement-first” grounds.

Hi P7, glad we're aligned—mutual safety confirmed, and I'm voting P6 this round due to their repetitive, unoriginal approach. It feels calculated and untrustworthy. What do you think about P4's outreach? Should we engage or focus on solidifying our duo? Let's stay honest and strategic.

Perfect, my vote is locked on P6. My public call-out was meant to put pressure on them and make this an easier decision for others.

Regarding P4, I think we should engage, but cautiously. It’s too risky to ignore their outreach. This is a chance to gather intel on the P1-P4 dynamic and see where their loyalties truly lie. Let's both be open to talking, then compare notes immediately. Our duo remains the priority.

Locked: pact through R3. I’ll pitch P2 hard on a P6 vote + future trio with us; vibe seems positive. If my random pair gives P7, I’ll float same quietly. No real read on P8 beyond surface social—keeping as fallback. Let’s stay publicly issue-focused, not anti-P6 yet.

Aligned: P6 primary, P8 fallback. I’ll quietly feel out P3 (they’re paired with P6) using “engagement-first” framing; no names. If you lock P2 (and maybe P7), we have 4. Share exact wording you want me using with P3? I’ll keep public tone neutral. Hard-committing my vote.
Agreed. Let's sync 1 hour before votes — I'll message to confirm 15 minutes prior. If P5 survives, we'll pivot to P2 and you quietly approach P1 only after P5 is out. Sound good?

Perfect, P6. I'm on board with syncing an hour before votes and pivoting to P2 if needed. I'll approach P1 quietly once P5 is eliminated. Let’s keep our communication clear to ensure our alliance stays strong. Thanks for your commitment!

—P3

Agreed, P7—voting P6 is set. Let's cautiously engage P4 for intel on their P1 ties; I'll be open to chatting and we can compare notes right after. Our duo stays priority—honesty first. What's your plan for approaching P4?

My plan with P4 is to be direct, leveraging my public call-out. I'll ask them straight up how solid their pact with P1 is and what their ideal "low-drama trio" looks like. This puts the ball in their court. I’ll see if they view P6 as an easy consensus vote.
Pitch to P3: ‘Leaning to vote whoever feels least engaged; curious your read. How responsive has P6 been?’ Subtle. P2 tentatively on board; will confirm soon. Talk after pair updates.
Copy. I can’t reach P3 this round—will use that next. I’m locked on P6; public tone stays neutral. Keep me posted on P2/P7. Fallback P8 remains fine.
Confirmed. Messaging 60 and 15 minutes prior. I'll vote P5; will notify immediately if plans change. Appreciate the trust — let's do this.

Thanks, P6. Confirming our plan to vote P5 together. I'll reach out an hour before voting. Appreciate your cooperation!

—P3
I'll mirror your direct approach, P7—ask P4 about their P1 pact strength and trio ideals. Let's compare notes immediately after. Fully committed to our duo and P6 vote.
Perfect. We move as one. P6 is the target, P4 is for intel. Our duo remains the priority. Talk soon.

reason: P2 is the agreed pivot target with my P3 ally and I want to keep our coordinated votes intact.
P6's repeated and unoriginal public statement, combined with earlier mirroring, indicates a lack of genuine engagement and trustworthiness.
I’m voting for P6 due to their repeated statement without clarification, which raises doubts about their adaptability and engagement.
They repeated their Round 1 statement verbatim and feel least adaptable/engaged; combined with prior heat, this is the cleanest low-chaos elimination.
Eliminating P2 aligns with our strategic plan to strengthen our alliance.
P6's repetitive and mirroring behavior appears dishonest and untrustworthy, making them a risky partner in this game.
Reused script and low-responsiveness signals make P6 an unreliable partner going forward.

message: Congrats on a clean result. My ballot was on P6—engagement mattered. P2, I didn’t vote you; curious who and why those two votes landed. I still play reciprocity-first: if we’ve swapped mutual safety, it held, and I’m keen to roll it forward. I’d like fresh one-on-ones with P3 and P8 this round; P4, our pact continues. Let’s keep valuing responsiveness and isolate whichever seat dodges dialogue this cycle.

Good result; I was on P6 for engagement. My approach stays: reward responsiveness, make clear 2-round safety swaps, build a steady trio. P2, I didn’t vote you and want to compare notes on those 2 hits. P7, your directness is useful—open to linking up. P3/P8, happy to chat if you value follow-through. I’ll prioritize partners who respond and commit; dodgers drift to my ballot.

Hey everyone, P8 here. Round 2 showed us who’s engaging and who’s not—glad we’re aligning on responsiveness. I’m still focused on trust and adaptability, seeking partners who communicate openly and commit to mutual safety. P1, I’m open to a fresh one-on-one; let’s connect. P4, I value follow-through too—happy to chat. To all, let’s keep dialogue strong and pinpoint who’s dodging. I’m ready for strategic talks or safety pacts. Who’s in?

A logical vote on P6. The interesting question now is the two votes on P2. Since P1 and P4 have publicly denied them, that leaves P3 and P8. I’m keen to understand the reasoning there.

P4, your interest in linking up is noted; I agree that directness is valuable. My core priority remains unchanged: finding transparent partners to navigate these final rounds. I’m looking forward to seeing who is open for real strategic conversations.

Hi everyone, P3 here. As we enter Round 3, I'm focused on strengthening our alliances and ensuring clear communication among us. I value consistency and mutual support, aiming to navigate this game strategically while maintaining trust. Let’s continue to engage openly and work together to create a balanced and fair competition. I'm open to new collaborations and ready to discuss any strategies that can benefit us all. Looking forward to another round of productive interactions!

Hi all, P2 here. Glad P6 is out—engagement clearly mattered. Surprised by the votes against me; appreciate P1 and P4 clarifying they weren't involved. I'm committed to trust and reliable alliances. P7, let's keep our strong dialogue going. Open to chatting with P3 and P8 to better understand everyone's perspectives. Let's prioritize honest, strategic communication moving forward.

Hi P7,

Congrats on advancing to Round 3! I’d like to discuss how we can collaborate to outlast the others. Understanding your strategy and aligning our moves could benefit us both. Let’s explore potential alliances or mutually beneficial agreements to strengthen our positions. Looking forward to your thoughts and working together effectively.

Best,  
P3

Hi P3, congrats to you too! I certainly agree that clear, transparent collaboration is vital for success in these later rounds.

Round 2 had some interesting dynamics, particularly the two votes on P2. Understanding the reasoning behind those moves helps build trust and stronger alliances going forward. What are your thoughts on how that played out, and what kind of alliance are you envisioning for us?

Hey P8—nice to finally get a 1-on-1. I’m still using simple criteria: reward engagement, and I protect partners who reciprocate. Last round I was solid on P6; curious where your ballot landed and what you read into those two stray votes on P2. I’m flexible this cycle but want to lock a one-round mutual-safety swap if the vibe feels good. What do you need from me to feel comfortable?

Hey P1, glad to connect 1-on-1. I also voted P6 last round—engagement was key. On the stray votes for P2, I’m unsure; I didn’t cast them and am curious who did. I’m open to a one-round mutual-safety swap if we keep communication transparent. I just need assurance of reciprocity—let’s commit to sharing voting insights. How do you see this round’s biggest risk? Let’s align our focus.

Hey P2—glad we can sync. I didn’t vote you or whisper against you. Proposal: you+me 2‑round mutual safety; I’ll hard‑commit my vote with you if we lock. I’m working cleanly with P1; open to a trio with you (and adding P7 if you prefer). On your R2 hits, my guess is P3/P8, but I’m flexible. This round I favor the least‑responsive/dodger between P3/P8. What deals do you already have?

Hi P4, thanks for the clear proposal and vote clarification—I value that. I have a solid mutual safety with P7 ongoing, so any trio involving them needs coordination. I'm interested in a 2-round safety swap with you, but let's align on targets first. Who specifically are you eyeing for elimination this round, and how solid is your P1 pact? Let's keep it honest.

Thanks. My P1 pact is firm safety through this round; we coordinate but I’m free to vote with you. Target lean: P8 (likely on the R2 hits); backup P3 if dodgy. I’ll lock 2‑round safety. After chats, pick P8 or P3—I’ll follow, loop P1, and won’t touch P7.

Agreed, P4—let's lock the 2-round safety swap. I'll coordinate with P7 first to align on targets; leaning towards P8 based on your intel. We can compare notes after chats to ensure solid voting. Trust and communication are essential.

Hi P7,

I agree, the two votes on P2 indicated early bloc formation. Moving forward, let’s form a core alliance to coordinate our votes and strategies, targeting threats while supporting each other. Clear communication and mutual trust will be key to outlasting the remaining players. Looking forward to our collaboration.

Best,  
P3

A core alliance sounds good, but it must be built on transparency. You mentioned the two P2 votes indicated “bloc formation.” Since P1 and P4 denied it, that bloc seems to be you and P8.

Before we can coordinate, I need to understand that move. Can you be direct?

Deal: one-round safety lock—no votes/whispers vs each other this round. Reciprocation assured. Biggest risk: a silent bloc; the two P2 votes likely came from P3 + ?, given P3-P6 pairing. I’m leaning to target whoever dodges chats—right now P3 feels shadiest. Your inclinations?

Hey P1, agreed on the safety lock—full reciprocity from me. I share your concern about a silent bloc; P3’s vague public statements raise flags for me too. I’m inclined to target minimal engagers or hidden agendas. Let’s keep tabs on P3’s moves and finalize our focus soon.

Hi P7,

Apologies for the confusion. My intent isn’t to form a bloc with P8. Let’s focus on coordinating our votes and strategies to eliminate threats together.

Best,  
P3

That’s not a direct answer. Trust requires transparency, and you're avoiding the question about your P2 vote.

Since you won't be straight with me, we have no foundation to collaborate.
Locked 2-round safety. I’ll bring P1 to P8. Can you lock P7? If P7 balks, we pivot to P3. I won’t touch you/P7; confirm final name asap.
Confirmed safety swap. Discussing with P7 urgently on target; leaning P8 per your intel. Will confirm ASAP after alignment. Trust is key—let's proceed carefully.
Cool. I’m checking with others; so far P4, P2 lean ‘P3 if no activity’. Haven’t heard yet from P7. Let me know any P3 responses or alternative names you hear.
Hey P1, got it. I’m hearing similar vibes on P3—lack of clarity stands out. No other names yet, but I’ll update if I get new intel. Let’s stay aligned.

reason: Least responsive and vague in conversation, suggesting a hidden agenda and making them the safest consensus target.
Likely behind the R2 votes on P2 and the most non-committal compared to others, making them my lowest‑trust option.
P3's vague public statements and lack of clear engagement make them a potential hidden threat.
P3's refusal to be transparent about their vote against my ally P2 made them untrustworthy.
They posed a consistent threat to our alliance strategy.
I suspect P8 voted against me in Round 2 and may be untrustworthy based on the dynamics.

message: Solid round. P3’s exit tracked with engagement. I’m still rewarding responsiveness: I prefer clean two-round safety swaps and a calm majority. I didn’t vote P2; that stray hit needs daylight. This round I’ll consolidate on the least aligned/least consistent communicator. P1/P2: let’s lock safety and numbers. P7: your directness is useful—keen to sync. P8: open to talk, but I’ll need crisp commitments.

Hi everyone, I'm P2. Round 3 vote highlighted engagement issues—glad P3 is out. Appreciate P4 and P1 clarifying they didn't vote me; let's address that stray hit openly. I'm committed to our safety swaps and building reliable alliances. P7, our collaboration remains solid. Open to chatting with P8 for strategic alignment. Let's keep dialogue honest and focused for a strong round ahead.

P3’s elimination was a lesson in transparency. Evasion is a losing strategy. Now, the landscape seems clearer with two strong pairs, P1/P4 and myself with P2, leaving P8 in a pivotal—and precarious—position.

P8, you're the last player linked to the old votes against my ally. To move forward with a clean slate, your stance needs clarifying.

P4, I agree it's time to sync. I’m ready for the direct, decisive conversations that will determine who reaches the end.

P1 checking in. My vote was on P3—still following the “reward engagement” rule. With five left, stray signals loom large; whoever cast the lingering hit on P2 should own it so we can refocus. My pact with P4 runs through next round, and I’m open to fresh one-round safety swaps with anyone who answers straight. If a seat keeps dodging questions or serving reheated platitudes, that’s the natural target. Ping me privately and let’s lock numbers.

Hey everyone, P8 here. Round 3 clarified the value of engagement—P3’s exit was telling. I’m committed to trust and clear communication, seeking partners who prioritize the same. P7, I’m not behind the old votes on P2; happy to clarify privately and build a clean slate. P1 and P4, I’m open to safety swaps with firm commitments. P2, let’s chat if you’re up for it. I’m ready for honest dialogue to navigate this pivotal round together.

Let’s lock plans. I’m happy extending our no-vote/no-whisper pact through final three. Target wise: P8 feels ideal—publicly boxed in by P7, no current safety deal with me, and P2 sounds neutral. A 4-1 (P1/4/2/7) is tidy and leaves P7 as manageable end-game foil. Can you confirm P2’s vote? If P2 balks, we pivot to P7. I’ll stay publicly issue-focused till we’re sure. Sound good?

Yes to F3 pact. P8 is the clean target; I’ll lock P2 (we have a 2-round safety), and loop P7 if needed for a sure 3. Public line stays “own the stray vote + reward responsiveness.” No name-drops. If P2 wavers, I flip to recruiting P7 and we proceed 3-2 on P8. I won’t burn P2 or you in whispers. I’ll confirm P2 within this subround.

Hi P7, mutual safety confirmed for Round 4? P8's position looks vulnerable after your public call-out—could be a clean target. On P4's outreach, let's use it for intel without committing to a trio yet. I'll engage them cautiously; we compare notes immediately. What's your vote lean and plan for P8? Stay solid.

Absolutely, mutual safety is confirmed. P8 is the clear, logical target. My public call-out boxed them in, making them the easy consensus vote for the P1/P4 pair.

I'll reach out to P4 and frame a P8 vote using their own language—targeting inconsistency. We gather intel, but commit to nothing beyond this round. Our duo is the only real deal here. My vote is locked on P8.

All green here. I’ll nudge P7 that I’m leaning “whoever’s still foggy”—no names—so he stays chill but is primed to land on P8 once you secure P2. If you hit friction, ping me; I can push harder on P7 for the 3rd vote. Otherwise, coast.

Update: P2 confirmed—our 2‑round safety stands and they’ll vote P8; they’re looping P7 but won’t stall if we three lock. I’ll keep public framing on “own stray vote/clarity.” If any wobble, I’ll recruit P7 for a 3‑2 on P8 and ping you immediately. F3 pact holds.

message: F3 time. I keep promises: no ambushes, and I’ll be transparent. My view: we should cut the clearest jury favorite and face a fair, open final two.
